definition: half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.chinese: 牠的下半生能夠改變嗎？

sentences.english: Being right half the time beats being half-right all the time.
sentences.chinese: 不怕半生皆是謬誤，只怕一生似是而非。

sentences.english: How do you like the steak served, wee - done or underdone?
sentences.chinese: 她用半生不熟的鹹肉和燒焦了的餅乾招待我們。

sentences.english: During the first half of life, people look ahead to the second half.
sentences.chinese: 在前半生裏，人們向前看後半生。

sentences.english: During the first half of life, people look ahead to the second half.
sentences.chinese: 在前半生裏，人們向前看後半生。

sentences.english: What could I do with the second half of my life to make it more meaningful than the first?
sentences.chinese: 要怎樣才能讓自己的後半生比之前更有意義？

sentences.english: Rose:You mean that I have to put half of my body in the dirty flood water?
sentences.chinese: 你是說我需要把下半生浸在這樣的髒水裏？

sentences.english: Which great Spanish artist lived most of his life in France?
sentences.chinese: 哪位偉大的西班牙畫家的大半生都在法國度過？

sentences.english: That's (the place) where he spent most of his life.
sentences.chinese: 那裏就是他度過大半生的地方。
我不要半生不熟的牛排。

sentences.english: It is the author's self-description of his half life's academic achievements.
sentences.chinese: 本文爲作者半生學術經歷的自述。

sentences.english: For much of my life I had little occasion to pay attention to eels.
sentences.chinese: 我的前半生很少有機會注意到鰻魚。

sentences.english: He has spent half his life writing this novel.
sentences.chinese: 他把半生心血花在這本小說的寫作上。

sentences.english: Attentive passed half a lifetime with hardship, tonight heavy walks into the wind and rain.
sentences.chinese: 勤勤苦苦已度過半生，今夜重又走入風雨。

sentences.english: And fifty-fifty the crude drugs bag soaks the medicinal preparation preparation craft to conduct the rational research.
sentences.chinese: 並對半生藥袋泡劑製備工藝進行合理性研究。

sentences.english: This meat flavor is very special, half ripe half a lifetime, is very delicious.
sentences.chinese: 這個肉味道很特別，半熟半生，很好喫的。

definition: to have experienced a lot of/to have been through
(literary) to slip/(of looks etc) to fade away/(of time) to slip away/to squander (time, opportunities)/to dillydally
to be all alone in the world
generation/period of 30 years/one's whole lifetime/lifelong/age/era/times/the whole world/the First (of numbered European kings)
homeless and miserable (idiom); to wander about in a desperate plight/to drift
